result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashawn Lewis

records.addlTxt:
11:14 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Lashawn Lewis in court. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
Defendant to seek counsel at this time.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  
The Court will adjourn.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/20/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to have no contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

3:03 PM Defendant Lashawn Lewis in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Lashawn Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Griffis appears as friend of the court. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
